title: "What is Fascination in Animal Magnetism and its Relation to Mesmerism, Somnambulism, and Hypnotism?"
first_phrase: This text discusses the experimentation and discoveries of animal magnetism, including mesmerism, somnambulism, catalepsy, and hypnotism. The final 200 tokens introduce the concept of fascination as a new branch of animal magnetism, discovered in 1875 by an unnamed lecturer. When successful, a subject becomes entranced, and their body language and physical state alter dramatically. It is worth noting that this state of submission only occurs after a subject has willingly submitted to the experiment. Theories surrounding animal magnetism often contradict each other, with some asserting the existence of an animalized fluid vital to these phenomena, despite no concrete evidence supporting this idea.
content: La fascination est une des modalités du magnétisme animal, terme générique embrassant l’ensemble d’une conception scientifique sur l'influence réciproque des êtres animés, et notamment de l'homme sur l’homme —duc à Mesmer, au siècle dernier. L’étude expérimentale du mesmérisme a provoqué les découvertes successives du somnambulisme artificiel, par le marquis de Puyscgur ; de la catalepsie magnétique, par le docteur Petctin ; de l'hypnotisme, par Braid, rameaux distincts sortis d'un même germe et qui ont porté des fruits aussi utiles que variés. La fascination expérimentale découverte par le conférencier en 1875 est une nouvelle branche de la science du magnétisme animal — et elle n’aura pas été la moins féconde en précieux résultats. last_phrase: In conclusion, the study of animal magnetism has led to numerous discoveries such as mesmerism, artificial somnambulism, magnetic catalepsy, hypnotism, and experimental fascination. While theories diverge and often contradict each other, it is important not to deny them indiscriminately. Rather, let us wait for further evidence and continue to explore the fascinating world of animal magnetism.
